devdoc.details: Checkpointing logic for BondingManager state for historical stake calculations.

checkpointBondingState(address,uint256,u.details: Since we checkpoint "delegator" and "transcoder" states, this is called both for the delegator and for the transcoder when any change is made to the bonds, including when rewards are calculated or claimed.

params._account: The account whose bonding state changed
params._startRound: The round from which the bonding state will be active. This is normally the next round.

checkpointTotalActiveStake(uint256,uint2.details: This is called only from the {BondingManager-setCurrentRoundTotalActiveStake} function to set the total active stake in the current round.

params._round: The round for which the total active stake is valid. This is normally the current round.

params._controller: Address of Controller that this contract will be registered with

delegatedAt(address,uint256).details: This is an addition to the IERC5805 interface to support our custom vote counting logic that allows delegators to override their transcoders votes. See {GovernorCountingOverridable-_handleVoteOverrides}.

getPastTotalSupply(uint256).details: This value is the sum of all *active* stake, which is not necessarily the sum of all voting power. Bonded stake that is not part of the top 100 active transcoder set is still given voting power, but is not considered here.

params._round: The round for which we want to get the total active stake.

getVotesAndDelegateAtRoundStart(address,.details: The value returned by this can also be calculated with the following logic using BondingManager functions at the start of the corresponding round: - If `isRegisteredTranscoder(_account)`, the result is `(transcoderTotalStake(_account), _account)` - Otherwise, the `delegate` is obtained from `getDelegator(_account).delegateAddress`  - If `isRegisteredTranscoder(delegate)`, the result is `(pendingStake(_account, 0), delegate)`  - Otherwise, the result is `(0, delegate)`

params._account: The account to get the voting power and delegate from.
params._round: The round at which to get the account state (at round start).

returns.delegateAddress: The address the account delegated to at the start of the given round.
returns.votes: The voting power of the account at the start of the given round.

totalSupply().details: This value is the sum of all *active* stake, which is not necessarily the sum of all voting power. Bonded stake that is not part of the top 100 active transcoder set is still given voting power, but is not considered here.

devdoc.title: BondingVotes

CLOCK_MODE().notice: Machine-readable description of the clock as specified in EIP-6372.

checkpointBondingState(address,uint256,u.notice: Called by the BondingManager when the bonding state of an account changes.

checkpointTotalActiveStake(uint256,uint2.notice: Called by the BondingManager when the total active stake changes.

clock().notice: Clock is set to match the current round, which is the checkpointing  method implemented here.

constructor.notice: BondingVotes constructor. Only invokes constructor of base Manager contract with provided Controller address

decimals().notice: Returns the decimals places of the token underlying the voting.

delegate(address).notice: Delegation through BondingVotes is not supported.

delegateBySig(address,uint256,uint256,ui.notice: Delegation through BondingVotes is not supported.

delegatedAt(address,uint256).notice: Returns the delegate that _account had chosen at the end of the provided past `_round`.

delegates(address).notice: Returns the delegate that _account has chosen. This means the delegated transcoder address in case of delegators, and the account's own address for transcoders (self-delegated).

getPastTotalSupply(uint256).notice: Returns the total supply of votes available at the end of the provided past `_round`.

getPastVotes(address,uint256).notice: Returns the amount of votes that `_account` had at the end of the provided past `_round`.

getTotalActiveStakeAt(uint256).notice: Get the total active stake at the start of a given round. Notice that this function is different from the {IERC5805Upgradeable} functions above that return the state at the *end* of the round. The state at the end of a round is equal to the state at the start of the next round, so to get the same result here, call this function with `round+1` instead.

getVotes(address).notice: Returns the current amount of votes that `_account` has. The voting power for a delegator is the amount they are delegating to a transcoder, while for transcoders it is all the stake delegated to them. If an account is not a registered transcoder ({BondingManager-isRegisteredTranscoder}), the voting power of itself and of all its delegators will be zero.

getVotesAndDelegateAtRoundStart(address,.notice: Gets the voting power and delegate of an account at the start of a given round. Notice that this function is different from the {IERC5805Upgradeable} functions above that return the state at the *end* of the round. The state at the end of a round is equal to the state at the start of the next round, so to get the same result here, call this function with `round+1` instead.

hasCheckpoint(address).notice: Returns whether an account already has any checkpoint.

name().notice: Returns the name of the virtual token implemented by this.

setController(address).notice: Set controller. Only callable by current controller

symbol().notice: Returns the symbol of the token underlying the voting power.

totalSupply().notice: Returns the current total supply of votes available.
